config.question: Why did Lord Baltimore’s feudal system fail on Chesapeake soil?

choices.content: People refused to play the social roles the lord had assigned them.
Baltimore did not design a social hierarchy for its members.
An elected assembly was never formed under his governance.
Baltimore regularly persecuted people for their religious beliefs.

answer_3.response: Baltimore’s feudal system never took root in Chesapeake soil because people refused to play the social roles the lord proprietor had assigned them.
